Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014005409.CaseDesc: Rene Bruneau was last seen at Saskatchewan Hospital in North Battleford on June 27, 1965. Mr. Bruneau was noticed missing the next morning. He is from Leoville, Saskatchewan. His immediate family have not heard from or seen Mr. Bruneau.

Scar: Head, Surgical scar on forehead, ear to ear, from removal of tumour

Case reference: 2008000499.CaseDesc: Kimberley Ann Amero was last seen at her residence in Saint John, New Brunswick on September 3, 1985. There has been no contact with family or friends since.

Case reference: 2014002991.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1988, Roberta Ferguson and eight other youths went to Sunnyside Campground at Cultus Lake in Chilliwack, BC. On August 24, 1988, Ms. Ferguson left the group on foot, it is believed she intended to return to her home in Surrey, British Columbia. Witnesses reported having seen a female walking on Columbia Valley Road, and others reported having seen a female getting into a vehicle at the intersection of Vedder Road and Cultus Lake Road. Ms. Ferguson has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2019002992.CaseDesc: On August 25, 2018, Anupama Nadagouda was seen for the last time with her daughter, Anvita Mulemane, in India.

Case reference: 2021036430.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, John Fruehauf was last seen near the American Falls located at Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Other, Light coloured worn underneath the long sleeve.
Other, Dark coloured with long sleeves

Case reference: 2014005595.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2011, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Sarah Davis was seen for the last time as she left the 
Juliette’s Place shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Sarah had gone there to retrieve her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000113.CaseDesc: Lana Derrick was given a ride from Houston, BC where she was going to college, to Terrace where she was dropped off at a friend's house.  Ms. Derrick spent the evening with friends hanging out in the Terrace downtown core.  In the early morning hours of October 7, 1995, Ms. Derrick picked up $30 from a friend's house and was last seen at the Copperside Foods/Petro Canada in Thornhill.  Her family reported her missing three days later when she did not show up for Thanksgiving dinner.

Case reference: 2022036931.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2022, Keith Zajac was seen for the last time in Brandon, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was traveling from Squamish, British Columbia to Ontario. That same day, his vehicle was located near Highway 1, approximately 10 kilometers west of Brandon. Several witnesses reported seeing Keith walking along the highway, westbound on the Assiniboine River's edge.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Hair shaved to one quarter; blonde, greying
Teeth: Left upper inciser broken and looks smaller

Case reference: 2021035166.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2021, Nicole Frenchman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Nicole was living with her friends, but had no fixed address. Nicole was normally very active on social media but has not accessed it since her disappearance.

Pierce: Upper Lip, Monroe piercing on left side
Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Leopard print
Right Side Of Neck, Red kiss lips
Right Hand, "Queen dubs dollar sign" on the middle finger
Right Forearm, Dreamcatcher; feathers; "Trust no one"

Case reference: 2014004979.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2007, Gad Krespine, a resident of Montreal, was last seen at approximately 10:30 am at 1755 Lierre Street in Laval, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014004086.CaseDesc: On July 13,1981, Sophia Armstrong was seen for the last time. Her companion reported that she had gone on a trip, which was out of character for Ms. Armstrong.

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2014004050.CaseDesc: On Saturday, June 25, 1994, Stephen Tudor was participating in a one man (solo) sailboat race from Port Huron to Mackinac Island.  The sailboat he was sailing, the "ANERIRIN" was located abandoned along the Goderich, Ontario shoreline. Police were unable to locate any signs of Mr. Tudor.

Case reference: 2015013522.CaseDesc: Richard St. Peter was in the process of moving residences. He was last heard from around Saturday March 14, 2015. It is not known where he may have gone, but he had vacated his last apartment and did not officially move into his new home.

Case reference: 2014004296.CaseDesc: On November 20, 2002, Lowell Flett was reported missing by his employer as he had failed to show up for work for the 5th day. Lowell was last seen by his girlfriend, on November 16th. He left the residence on his ski-doo and has not been seen since. Despite intensive land and water searches neither Lowell nor his ski-doo have been located. He is presumed to have drowned as a result of his sled falling through the ice.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2014001584.CaseDesc: Alexander Petritsis was last seen June 30, 1994, in Montreal. He left his residence with his car, without saying where he was going to anyone. On that day, Alexander did not go to work.

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2014005425.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2010, at approximately 6:00 a.m., Tong-kok Lam was seen for the last time by her husband as he left their home to go to work. When Tong-kok’s husband returned, she and some of her personal belongings were gone.

Case reference: 2006011299.CaseDesc: Henry Atlookan left Whiteclay Lake in a canoe to travel 55 km to Armstrong, Ontario. He may have been seen on June 25, 1968 making a purchase at a local store in the Town of Armstrong. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005581.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2011, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Steven Lapowich was last seen at Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Steven boarded a flight to Puerto Rico, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2013000019.CaseDesc: On December 18, 2001, Terry Sagal was last seen leaving his South Regina house at approximately 11:00 am. Prior to leaving he took $50.00 cash and mentioned to his wife that he was going to get gas, pick up scotch and go to the Superstore. Shortly after leaving, Terry's Petro-Points card was used at the Albert South Petro Canada on a $26.00 purchase.

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2014005330.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2009, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Rose Mackinnon was seen for the last time when she left the Earnestine Women’s shelter with her two children. Rose advised that she would be returning but has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005031.CaseDesc: Eric Gagnon was seen for the last time over the course of the night on May 25-26, 1996 in Trois-Pistoles, Quebec. Eric drove his ex-girlfriend to "Le Bellevue" Night Club sometime in the early hours of the evening. His vehicle was later recovered at his home.

Case reference: 2018063453.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2003, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Senotta Thomas was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Senotta had left her home to go to work, but did not return home.

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2017072938.CaseDesc: On March 8, 1988, Nadine Sharp was seen for the last time. She was a student at the University of Toronto and went missing from her home in Etobicoke, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017010385.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Fadi Zakir was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2016041786.CaseDesc: LeRoi La France was reported missing on March 31, 2016 when LeRoi’s siblings learned that a formal missing person report had never been made regarding their brother. He was last seen in October or November of 1964. In 1964 LeRoi was a student at UBC who lived in Burnaby BC and insured a 1952 VW Beetle.

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004911.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1974, Ellice Harper, his wife and their young child were out on the lake duck hunting and fishing on Red Sucker Lake, Manitoba. At one point in the day, the party stopped on shore to eat. During this stop, they noticed a storm coming in. By the time they left there were already waves forming as they started out across the lake. The wind increased and the waves were so strong that they would almost cause the vessel to flip over. The boat filled with water and a wave took him out of the boat. His wife and child drifted in the boat until they reached shore and were later rescued. It is presumed Ellice drowned.

Case reference: 2018054598.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 2018, Dwayne Lavallee was seen for the last time in his vehicle leaving the Ebb and Flow First Nation community and the vehicle was located on September 26th, north of the community of Ste. Rose du Lac, Manitoba.

Jacket: Black, Yellow, Work jacket with reflective stripes

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Rufus Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014002360.CaseDesc: On August 25, 1996, Benoit Lachance was seen for the last time in the Pointes-Aux-Trembles District in Montreal, Quebec. Benoit was a member of a motorcycle club called the "Rowdy Crew" and drove a blue Chevrolet Camaro.

Scar: Middle Back, Bullet still in the back

Case reference: 2016013379.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2016, at approximately 4:00 a.m., Gilberto Cardinal-Fernandes was seen for the last time when he left his apartment to go for a walk in Gatineau, Quebec. Gilberto left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Worn in long Dreadlocks, long brown beard

Case reference: 2014001247.CaseDesc: On July 3, 1989, Henry and his brother, William Gerbrand, were fishing in a canoe on Codette Lake near Nipawin, SK. At approximately 8:00 p.m., boaters heard calls for help. It is suspected that both men drowned; divers were unable to find them.

Case reference: 2006012599.CaseDesc: Ralph Grant was last seen in the Huntsville area between January 28 and February 22, 1999. He resided on Yearly Road, Huntsville.

Amputation: Lower jaw surgically removed due to cancer

Case reference: 2014003770.CaseDesc: Herbert Gross was to meet his girlfriend for lunch on May 4, 1996. He failed to show up, which was extremely out of character for him. On May 7th, a man described as being Caucasian, in his mid-20s, 5'7 and 140-150 lbs, clean shaven with short, brown hair, was seen moving items from Mr. Gross's suite. This man was wearing a dark shirt, faded jeans and white runners. Police feel Mr. Gross may have been the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2018063868.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2018, Apu Akbar was last seen by his roommates at his home in St. John’s, Newfoundland. Apu's grey Honda Civic was located on November 8, 2018, in the area of Kavanagh’s Lane and Windgap Road in Flatrock, Newfoundland. The keys were still in the ignition and his cellphone was found in the vehicle. Apu is originally from Bangladesh.

Case reference: 2014001277.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1987, Sukhminder Singh Grewal was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. He came to Canada and performed as a singer in an East Indian Music Troupe that toured across the country. Sukhminder has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020011912.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2017, Jeffrey Caporale was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Shortly before his disappearance, Jeffrey had been treated at the University of Alberta hospital.

Case reference: 2014005606.CaseDesc: Larry Duck of Tadoule Lake was last seen in April of 2011, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Larry has not made contact with his family since. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020013.CaseDesc: Angeline Pete was last seen on May 26, 2011 leaving her residence in North Vancouver, BC.  Miss Pete's disappearance is suspicious and foul play cannot be excluded.

Hair: Brown, Long, Dyed, Often dyes it

Case reference: 2014004103.CaseDesc: Michelle Gurney was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver at the St. James Community Society building on December 11, 1998. She was reported missing ten days later. Ms. Gurney was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and had mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014000018.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2001, Dawn Rees was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Dawn was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2005004599.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1996, an unidentified man, believed to be Caucasian was recovered from the Sir Adam Beck Dam in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 145 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10" to 5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He has evidence of heart disease and may have had heart problems in the past. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days up to two weeks prior to discovery. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Long, Long grey and white beard 12cm
Teeth: No upper teeth and no lower posterior teeth; remaining teeth have roots only; crowns are lost due to decay.

Case reference: 2017013186.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2017, Cameron Duffy was seen for the last time near the Rainbow Bridge in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Hood trimmed with fur

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002557.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2000, Craig Snider left his family's place in Coquitlam to go to work as a commercial fisherman at Stevenson Marina in Richmond, British Columbia and has never been seen or heard from since. 
Mr Snider commuted regularly from Port Alberni, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2012020117.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1995, Chantal Picotte was reported missing by her mother. Chantal was last seen on the evening of Wednesday, November 22, 1995 at a bar in Saint-Jérôme, Quebec.  She had called her mother that evening asking her to come see her. The next day, Chantal's mother went to her daughter’s residence, but Chantal was not there. The mother made several attempts to call her daughter without any success.

Case reference: 2013000069.CaseDesc: Richard Riquier was last seen in Montreal on April 17, 1973. He might be in a religious cult in the United States or in India.

Case reference: 2020008557.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1984, at approximately 10:00 am, Rodolf Scoulde was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Rodolf was on his way to a nearby store.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Sword and heart with the word "COCO"

Case reference: 2014001522.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1977, James Stackhouse and a friend were camped on a small island on the east shore of Lake Winnipeg, north of Hole River where they were doing some mapping. Their boat drifted away to the south towards Deer Island located 3 miles south. At approximately 6:00 p.m. both men left the shore holding onto some small logs that they had tied together with their belts. They attempted to swim to Deer Island but the current and the waves carried them to 1/4 mile east of Deer Island. The bundle of logs that they had tied broke and the men were separated. Mr. Stackhouse's friend managed to swim to Deer Island but he did not see Mr. Stackhouse again. Searches of the area were done by land, air and water but the body of Mr. Stackhouse was not recovered. He is presumed deceased due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014028357.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2014, Meysam Mokri was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Port Moody, British Columbia with a duffel bag containing some of his clothing. Meysam has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Leather, White, Runners, Air Jordan brand, size 9

Case reference: 2014005399.CaseDesc: Jason Picken was reported missing to police in May 2008 in Cowansville, Quebec. Jason has not been seen or heard from by his entourage since March 24th, 2008. Following subsequent investigations, investigators believe Jason may have been the victim of foul play.

Scar: Eyes, Scar on the right eye

Case reference: 2014002353.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1978, two men found a racing canoe and called the police. During the ensuing investigation, it was discovered that there were two men in the canoe, apparently on their way to dig for Seneca root on Moose Lake in Manitoba. According to witnesses who saw the men leave, they left in adverse weather conditions, including high winds. Reuban has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014002539.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, Amelie McArthur’s vehicle was found running with the lights on and the driver’s side door open on the Taylor Bridge in Taylor, BC. Amelie was last seen leaving her home in Taylor in that vehicle earlier that morning.

Case reference: 2018056500.CaseDesc: On August 2 1997, Ronald Halpern was last seen leaving his residence to go to the Toronto International Airport. Ronald boarded a flight traveling to the Dominican Republic.

Case reference: 2006008299.CaseDesc: Richard Rollo jumped out of his boat into Muskrat Lake, near Gull Rock, Cobden, Ontario in 1997 and never resurfaced.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2017074237.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1999, the partial remains of an adult male were discovered in a wooded area off of Tower Road, south of the Town of Mactier, in Severn Township, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014003985.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1974 Randall Crighton was seen for the last time in Richmond, British Columbia. He was involved in a motor vehicle accident with a friend who had left the scene. Randall has not been seen or heard from since. Randall had substance abuse problems and may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005364.CaseDesc: Antoinette Neveu was reported missing on January 11, 1991, after failing to arrive at her place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004607.CaseDesc: George Robichaud was last seen by his roommate on March 15, 2005, at their home in Moncton, New Brunswick. George was suffering from mental health issues at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2019029100.CaseDesc: Robert Allen Wetsch was reported missing by family on May 19, 2019. There have not been any confirmed sightings of him since.

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription
Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls

Case reference: 2012020002.CaseDesc: Perry Sebastian was last seen December 26, 2011. Perry is from the Hagwilget First Nations reserve and reported missing from the Southbank area of Burns Lake, British Columbia. He was reportedly despondent.

Case reference: 2006017099.CaseDesc: Joan Dorothy Lawrence last resided on North Lancelot Road, Huntsville.

Case reference: 2006012899.CaseDesc: Delmar Henderson was last seen in the area of Burnt River (Kinmount), Ontario on June 2, 1983.

Case reference: 2014004925.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2007, Michael Bailey was last seen by the Thunder Bay Police on Bowlker Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Michael is known to travel on foot, and avoided being around people. During the time of his disappearance, he was living a transient lifestyle, and camped in wooded areas.

Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Blue, BUSH, Flannel jacket in the colours grey, blue, beige and brown
Shoes: White, Orange, RUNNERS, Running shoes in the colours white, orange and navy blue
Sweater: Blue, HOODIE, Hooded sweater in the colour navy blue

Case reference: 2014005532.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1984, Emily Koble had been picked up by two ladies that felt she had appeared lost and confused. Emily was dropped off near Christopher Lake, Saskatchewan when she asked to get out of the vehicle. The ladies called the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, however, a search failed to locate her.

Deformity: Shoulders, Steel pin, unknown which shoulder

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2006000399.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1988, the body of a Caucasian male was recovered from the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 132lbs; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Auburn, Bald, Wavy, Balding in front, sideburns and unshaven with several days growth
Teeth: Many amalgam fillings, 1 composite resin restoration. Missing multiple upper and lower posterior teeth prior to death.
Belt: Leather, Brown, Size 34, with gold buckle & "Genuine Olde English Leather" written on the inner portion
Jeans: Blue, "Renée de France" Brand, size 34" waist and 34" inseam
Money: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Canadian coins $2.26, one American dime
Fractured/Broken Bones: Healed fracture, noticeable bump on the middle of his right collarbone.

Case reference: 2013000078.CaseDesc: Candelerio Rodriguez has been missing from Montreal since August 18, 2003 . Mr. Rodriguez might be in the United States.

Case reference: 2014003128.CaseDesc: Olimpia Mikszan was last seen on the morning of June 21, 1996, outside her residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  She was living alone in a rental suite.  Her vehicle and nearly all of her personal belongings were left at her residence.  Olimpia had just completed high school.  Olimpia was born in Poland, speaks fluent Polish and has a slight Polish accent when speaking English.

Case reference: 2010006399.CaseDesc: Glen Wesley, a patient at the Northeast Mental Health Hospital, was granted permission to leave the facility on his birthday. Staff believe he went to downtown North Bay. Mr. Wesley did not return and was noticed missing at approximately 2:15 PM. He suffers from Schizophrenia which requires medication. Since his disappearance there have been several unconfirmed sightings of Mr. Wesley in the Cochrane, Timmins and New Liskeard areas.

Case reference: 2006025299.CaseDesc: Eetu Vainonen has been missing from the Thunder Bay (Port Arthur) area since sometime during 1935 to 1936.

Case reference: 2014030834.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1967 at approximately 9:00 a.m. John Pawloski, his common-law wife and a young boy (9 years old) were fishing in the area of Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. John's fishing rod started to slip into the water and he ran to reach at it. He fell into the fast moving water. His wife attempted to rescue him, but she too slipped on the rocks and fell into the water. The young boy ran to get help and when he looked back he could no longer see the couple.  The body of John's wife was found down the river shortly after the incident. Searches for John's body were done by air, land and water but the body was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester Fehr was last seen on November 27, 2012, at approximately 5:30 P.M. in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving, he told numerous family and friends goodbye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2014005482.CaseDesc: Shaun Chris MacDonald-McLaughlin was reported missing on March 27, 2010 by his step-father. Shaun was last seen by his roommate on March 12, 2010, in Vancouver, British Columbia when he packed his belongings and stated he was going home. Shaun was known to have substance abuse problems and was diagnosed as a paranoid-schizophrenic.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee
